Breadth-First.Explanation: Broadly describes architectural style and lists multiple European countries without a firm hypothesis
Continues general clue collection and possible contexts (student dorms, NRW, TU Munich) without deep verification
Leans toward Germany and various cities (Cologne, Berlin, Munich) but still shallowly compares without targeted analysis
Jumps between several specific location hypotheses (Gaußstraße, Jena, Göttingen, Freiburg, Hamburg, Delft) with quick, shallow comparisons

Depth-First.Explanation: Focuses on path geometry, tree species and sun position to verify the northern Germany dorm hypothesis
Depth-First.KeyElement: Path curves with grass edges and sun-shadow orientation

Depth-First.Explanation: Examines pavement type, drainage channel and beveled stones to confirm or refute German vs Swiss features
Depth-First.KeyElement: Metal drainage channel and square pavers

Depth-First.Explanation: Conducts detailed matching of building materials, paving, lamp‐post and bicycle style to Tanthof-West
Depth-First.KeyElement: Yellow brick columns alternating with concrete panels in Tanthof-West

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Converged on a specific hypothesis (northern Germany) and began targeted clue verification
After verifying German indicators, contradictions prompted exploration of new hypotheses across regions
Settled on the Netherlands hypothesis and shifted to in-depth feature matching
